books.title: The National Being
books.author: George William Russell
books.summary: An Irish writer presents his vision of an independent Irish nation.

books.title: The Three Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A group of recently-pardoned former vigilantes aids Scotland Yard in bringing a gang of thugs and murderers to justice.

books.title: An Autobiography
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: The autobiography of American President Theodore Roosevelt.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Through the Looking-Glass
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: In a follow-up to her adventures in Wonderland, Alice finds herself in a mirror image of the whimsical land where she becomes a queen in her own right.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: Henry V
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Shakespeare’s 1599 play chronicling the history of King Henry the Fifth and his famous victory over the French at the Battle of Agincourt.

books.title: The Book of Wonder
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A collection of fantastical short stories.

books.title: The Elusive Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A French official schemes to finally catch the Scarlet Pimpernel.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Murder at the Vicarage
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A vicar attempts to unravel the mystery of a murder that took place in his study, while his neighbor—an elderly spinster—takes an interest.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.

books.title: The American Crisis
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A collection of articles written during the American Revolutionary War that outline Paine’s support for a self-governing America.

books.title: Songs of the Cattle Trail and Cow Camp
books.author: John A. Lomax
books.summary: A collection of cowboy poetry collected by folklorist John A. Lomax.

books.title: The History of Rasselas, Prince of Abyssinia
books.author: Samuel Johnson
books.summary: An Abyssinian prince embarks on adventures while exploring the meaning of happiness.

books.title: Pellucidar
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An adventurer returns to the hollow interior of the Earth in search of his lost love.

books.title: Lord Peter Views the Body
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: A collection of short stories in which an aristocratic amateur detective solves a variety of crimes.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.
